text: An economic surplus is when you have more of something in the economy than people demand. There are two types: Consumers' surplus is the gain by consumers who can buy a product for less than the highest price that they would be willing to pay. Producers' surplus is the amount got by producers who sell at a market price higher than the least they would be willing to sell for. == References == Category:Microeconomics Category:Welfare economics
title: Economic surplus
